50 class TiledRange1 {
51  private:
52  struct Enabler {};
53 
54  public:
55  typedef std::size_t size_type;
56  typedef std::pair<size_type, size_type> range_type;
57  typedef std::vector<range_type>::const_iterator const_iterator;
58 
66  TiledRange1()
67  : range_(0, 0), elements_range_(0, 0), tiles_ranges_(), elem2tile_() {}
68 
71  template <typename RandIter,
72  typename std::enable_if<
73  detail::is_random_iterator<RandIter>::value>::type* = nullptr>
74  TiledRange1(RandIter first, RandIter last)
75  : range_(), elements_range_(), tiles_ranges_(), elem2tile_() {
76  init_tiles_(first, last, 0);
77  }
78 
80  TiledRange1(const TiledRange1& rng) = default;
81 
83  TiledRange1(TiledRange1&& rng) = default;
84 
86 
92  template <typename... _sizes>
93  explicit TiledRange1(const size_type& t0, const _sizes&... t_rest) {
94  const size_type n = sizeof...(_sizes) + 1;
95  size_type tile_boundaries[n] = {t0, static_cast<size_type>(t_rest)...};
96  init_tiles_(tile_boundaries, tile_boundaries + n, 0);
97  }
98 
100 
106  explicit TiledRange1(const std::initializer_list<size_type>& list) {
107  init_tiles_(list.begin(), list.end(), 0);
108  }
109 
111  TiledRange1& operator=(const TiledRange1& rng) = default;
112 
114  TiledRange1& operator=(TiledRange1&& rng) = default;
115 
117  const_iterator begin() const { return tiles_ranges_.begin(); }
118 
120  const_iterator end() const { return tiles_ranges_.end(); }
121 
123  bool empty() const { return tiles_ranges_.empty(); }
124 
126  const_iterator find(const size_type& e) const {
127  if (!includes(elements_range_, e)) return tiles_ranges_.end();
128  const_iterator result = tiles_ranges_.begin();
129  result += element_to_tile(e);
130  return result;
131  }
132 
134  [[deprecated]] const range_type& tiles() const { return range_; }
135 
137 
139  const range_type& tiles_range() const { return range_; }
140 
142  const range_type& elements() const { return elements_range_; }
143 
145 
147  const range_type& elements_range() const { return elements_range_; }
148 
150  size_type tile_extent() const { return range_.second - range_.first; }
151 
153  size_type extent() const {
154  return elements_range_.second - elements_range_.first;
155  }
156 
158 
165  const range_type& tile(const size_type i) const {
166  TA_ASSERT(includes(range_, i));
167  return tiles_ranges_[i - range_.first];
168  }
169 
171 
183  const size_type& element_to_tile(const size_type& i) const {
184  TA_ASSERT(includes(elements_range_, i));
185  if (elem2tile_.empty()) {
186  init_elem2tile_();
187  }
188  return elem2tile_[i - elements_range_.first];
189  }
190 
192  [[deprecated]] const size_type& element2tile(const size_type& i) const {
193  return element_to_tile(i);
194  }
195 
197 
200  void swap(TiledRange1& other) { // no throw
201  std::swap(range_, other.range_);
202  std::swap(elements_range_, other.elements_range_);
203  std::swap(tiles_ranges_, other.tiles_ranges_);
204  std::swap(elem2tile_, other.elem2tile_);
205  }
206 
207  template <typename Archive,
208  typename std::enable_if<madness::archive::is_input_archive<
209  Archive>::value>::type* = nullptr>
210  void serialize(const Archive& ar) {
211  ar& range_& elements_range_& tiles_ranges_& elem2tile_;
212  }
213 
214  template <typename Archive,
215  typename std::enable_if<madness::archive::is_output_archive<
216  Archive>::value>::type* = nullptr>
217  void serialize(const Archive& ar) const {
218  ar& range_& elements_range_& tiles_ranges_& elem2tile_;
219  }
220 
221  private:
222  static bool includes(const range_type& r, size_type i) {
223  return (i >= r.first) && (i < r.second);
224  }
225 
227  template <typename RandIter>
228  static void valid_(RandIter first, RandIter last) {
229  // Verify at least 2 elements are present if the vector is not empty.
230  TA_USER_ASSERT((std::distance(first, last) >= 2),
231  "TiledRange1 construction failed: You need at least 2 "
232  "elements in the tile boundary list.");
233  // Verify the requirement that a0 < a1 < a2 < ...
234  for (; first != (last - 1); ++first)
235  TA_USER_ASSERT(
236  *first < *(first + 1),
237  "TiledRange1 construction failed: Invalid tile boundary, tile "
238  "boundary i must be greater than tile boundary i+1 for all i. ");
239  }
240 
242  template <typename RandIter>
243  void init_tiles_(RandIter first, RandIter last, size_type start_tile_index) {
244 #ifndef NDEBUG
245  assert(start_tile_index ==
246  0); // non-zero-based tile indices are not (yet?) supported
247  valid_(first, last);
248 #endif // NDEBUG
249  range_.first = start_tile_index;
250  range_.second = start_tile_index + last - first - 1;
251  elements_range_.first = *first;
252  elements_range_.second = *(last - 1);
253  for (; first != (last - 1); ++first)
254  tiles_ranges_.emplace_back(*first, *(first + 1));
255  }
256 
258  void init_elem2tile_() const {
259  // check for 0 size range.
260  if ((elements_range_.second - elements_range_.first) == 0) return;
261 
262  static std::mutex mtx;
263  {
264  std::lock_guard<std::mutex> lock(mtx);
265  if (elem2tile_.empty()) {
266  // initialize elem2tile map
267  elem2tile_.resize(elements_range_.second - elements_range_.first);
268  const size_type end = range_.second - range_.first;
269  for (size_type t = 0; t < end; ++t)
270  for (size_type e = tiles_ranges_[t].first;
271  e < tiles_ranges_[t].second; ++e)
272  elem2tile_[e - elements_range_.first] = t + range_.first;
273  }
274  }
275  }
276 
277  friend std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream&, const TiledRange1&);
278 
279  // TiledRange1 data
280  range_type range_;
281  range_type elements_range_;
282  std::vector<range_type>
283  tiles_ranges_;
284  mutable std::vector<size_type>
285  elem2tile_;
286 
287 }; // class TiledRange1
288 
290 inline void swap(TiledRange1& r0, TiledRange1& r1) { // no throw
291  r0.swap(r1);
292 }
293 
295 inline bool operator==(const TiledRange1& r1, const TiledRange1& r2) {
296  return std::equal(r1.begin(), r1.end(), r2.begin()) &&
297  (r1.tiles_range() == r2.tiles_range()) &&
298  (r1.elements_range() == r2.elements_range());
299 }
300 
302 inline bool operator!=(const TiledRange1& r1, const TiledRange1& r2) {
303  return !operator==(r1, r2);
304 }
305 
307 inline std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& out, const TiledRange1& rng) {
308  out << "( tiles = [ " << rng.tiles_range().first << ", "
309  << rng.tiles_range().second << " ), elements = [ "
310  << rng.elements_range().first << ", " << rng.elements_range().second
311  << " ) )";
312  return out;
313 }
314 
316 
323 inline TiledRange1 concat(const TiledRange1& r1, const TiledRange1& r2) {
324  std::vector<TiledRange1::size_type> hashmarks;
325  hashmarks.reserve(r1.tile_extent() + r2.tile_extent() + 1);
326  if (!r1.empty()) {
327  hashmarks.push_back(r1.tile(0).first);
328  for (const auto& tile : r1) {
329  hashmarks.push_back(tile.second);
330  }
331  for (const auto& tile : r2) {
332  hashmarks.push_back(hashmarks.back() + tile.second - tile.first);
333  }
334  return TiledRange1(hashmarks.begin(), hashmarks.end());
335  } else {
336  return r2;
337  }
338 }
339 
341 
346 inline bool is_congruent(const TiledRange1& r1, const TiledRange1& r2) {
347  return std::equal(r1.begin(), r1.end(), r2.begin(),
348  [](const auto& tile1, const auto& tile2) {
349  return (tile1.second - tile1.first) ==
350  (tile2.second - tile2.first);
351  });
352 }
